page.title: 01Synopsis of this Block.
page.content: This block is situated at the junction of the S.Shrops. Hills with the N.Shrops.Plain. A view of the area from the ridge at Little Lyth (O.S. 477071_photo A) reveals the railway line from {Shrewsbury}to{Hereford}and the{A49 running N/S along the foot of the ridge through the western end of the section.This busy road neatly bisects the village of{Bayston Hill}(photo B), cutting off the older settlement to the east from the modern housing estates to the west. Beyond this the landscape rolls away,showing typical glacial deposits of sand and gravel,containing in its hollows the 3 small meres{Bomere,} {Shomere}and{Betton Pool.} The farming is largely arable although some sheep and cattle are kept as well.
